ad14fbc4-9742-4ff4-a84a-960840eaf786.description: Each year, PLA acknowledges excellence in our industry through its prestigious Awards of Excellence. These annual awards recognise and celebrate the outstanding initiatives and innovative efforts of 'the people behind the places'. The objective of the PLA Awards of Excellence judging process is to evaluate each entry fairly and independently through a formal process. Judges are experts in their field and this expertise is matched to the relevant category for assessment.
ad14fbc4-9742-4ff4-a84a-960840eaf786.name: Parks & Leisure Australia Awards of Excellence Judge 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Each judge is expected to fully participate in the judging process. They will:
Uphold the integrity and value of the Awards of Excellence program.
Act completely without bias, declaring any interest which may conflict or be seen to conflict with the ability to make a fair assessment and be prepared to withdraw from such assessment.
Hold or working towards becoming a Certified Parks and Leisure Professional (not essential).
Use their knowledge and experience to assess entries during their assessment and deliberation day.
Attempt to always reach consensus and to keep in mind the outward focus of the Awards of Excellence program.
Check all entries meet the correct category criteria and re - allocate into correct categories if necessary.
Provide scores and written comments on all entrants and award winners.
Judges should be actively involved within the parks and leisure industry.

e679a037-b44a-4ae0-8da2-cafa1653a1bb.description: Each year, PLA acknowledges excellence in our industry through its prestigious Awards of Excellence. These annual awards recognise and celebrate the outstanding initiatives and innovative efforts of 'the people behind the places'. Head Judges are experts in their field and this expertise is matched to the relevant category for assessment. The Head Judge provides oversight on the judging in order to ensure consistency and rigour in the process.
e679a037-b44a-4ae0-8da2-cafa1653a1bb.name: Parks & Leisure Australia Awards of Excellence Head Judge 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Previous experience in judging Parks and Leisure Australia Awards of Excellence.
Actively involved within the parks and leisure industry at a senior level, with at least 10 years’ experience within the parks and leisure industry.
Hold or working towards becoming a Certified Parks and Leisure Professional (not essential).
Head Judges will:
Co-ordinate, attend and chair deliberation meetings.
Provide and adhere to the Code of Conduct as per policies and procedures.
Be the “face” of the judging panels and the liaison between panel and the Awards Team.
Uphold the integrity and value of the Awards of Excellence program.
Act completely without bias, declaring any interest which may conflict or be seen to conflict with the ability to make a fair assessment and be prepared to withdraw from such assessment.
Use their knowledge and experience to assess entries during their assessment and deliberation day.
Attempt to always reach consensus and to keep in mind the outward focus of the Awards of Excellence program.

f966fcb2-ac58-45cf-95b8-e1a96437ddfa.description: The Certified Parks and Leisure Professional (CPLP) industry certification is the Australian national benchmark for industry professionals. The certification is based on a candidates' knowledge, skills, and abilities in Asset Management, Landscape and Amenity Horticulture, Operations and Maintenance, Project Management, Resource Management, Business Acumen, Supervision, Interpretation and Education, Public Health, Leadership, and Recreation.
f966fcb2-ac58-45cf-95b8-e1a96437ddfa.name: Certified Parks and Leisure Professional

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Holds a current Parks and Leisure Australia membership

Have a university degree in a relevant field to the parks and leisure industry and have two years of park and/or leisure work experience providing competency in at least three of the CPLP competencies.
OR Five years of senior-level park and/or leisure management experience providing competency in at least four of the CPLP competencies.
OR Five years of park or leisure management experience and completion of training as approved by Parks and Leisure Australia that sufficiently meets at least five CPLP competencies.

bacc43cf-3f15-4d7d-ae2b-cf9210eafdbd.description: This award acknowledges outstanding and innovative achievement in the area of technology application and how that application has benefited the industry.
bacc43cf-3f15-4d7d-ae2b-cf9210eafdbd.name: Best Use of Technology National Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: The technology is new and accessible to the parks and leisure industry
It fulfills a gap within the industry
Promotes efficiencies, impact on resources and ease of application
The technology is innovative and or improves the practice/progress within the industry

eef72736-0db6-407c-b85a-69b7091c6a6f.description: This award acknowledges outstanding and innovative achievement in the area of technology application and how that application has benefited the industry.
eef72736-0db6-407c-b85a-69b7091c6a6f.name: Best Use of Technology WA Region Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: The technology is new and accessible to the parks and leisure industry

77fb3d1f-66ff-440f-b565-5d7b52627386.description: This award is designed to recognise the combined effort that is required to successfully plan, organise and manage effective initiatives, projects, programs, events and/or festivals which promote and enhance leisure time for a number of social, environmental and economic benefits to the community. Evidence of the success should form a component of the submission.
77fb3d1f-66ff-440f-b565-5d7b52627386.name: Community Based Initiative of the Year VIC/TAS Region Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates positive outcomes the initiative achieved
The initiative/s has a positive impact on bringing the community together
The initiative celebrates access for all, equity and equality
The initiative promotes diversity and reflects the culture and heritage of the community
The initiative reduces the impact to the environment and promotes liveability

8eadd5ff-5ed6-4cc9-a2b5-a66ec2408b0a.description: This award recognises community events which receive third party sponsorship and charge an admission or participation fee. The event is commercial (major sponsorship / partnerships) in nature and promotes community participation through industry related events.
8eadd5ff-5ed6-4cc9-a2b5-a66ec2408b0a.name: Major Event of the Year SA/NT Region Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates innovation and sustainability (economically and with ongoing operation of the event).
Demonstrates successful outcomes of its evaluation
Benefits the community or target market
The extent to which the event enhances social connection, participation and celebrates the community in which it is developed

c8da1ea7-c08c-4226-887b-ca5cb8118d15.description: Regional/Rural Australia includes all of the towns, small cities and areas that lie beyond the major capital cities (Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide, Darwin, Hobart and Canberra) who make a significant contribution through community initiatives which contribute to the parks and leisure industry. These projects can be playspaces, events, tourism, trails, programs, repurposing of facilities and environmental initiatives (ie. water saving, habitat development and restoration projects).
c8da1ea7-c08c-4226-887b-ca5cb8118d15.name: Best Regional / Rural Industry Contribution SA/NT Region Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: The initiative addresses any social, cultural, heritage, environmental or economic issues
Innovative approaches were taken
The extent to which barriers and difficulties existed for the initiative and how have been overcome
Highlights the community members which supported and benefited from the initiative
Contribution to lasting solutions and sustainability and the benefits to the community, the region and the industry

df48fc20-313c-4029-9136-1600e73b193a.description: Regional/Rural Australia includes all of the towns, small cities and areas that lie beyond the major capital cities (Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide, Darwin, Hobart and Canberra) who make a significant contribution through community initiatives which contribute to the parks and leisure industry. 5edf0614-65aa-4d7a-bf22-1dfde43ed2af.description: This award celebrates and promotes vibrant, successful well designed and managed new or significantly revitalised parks/ open spaces by recognising and rewarding exceptional examples of best practice in terms of design and management. This includes parks and open spaces that are large, small, linear, along transport corridors, road closures, foreshore and reclaimed urban spaces.
5edf0614-65aa-4d7a-bf22-1dfde43ed2af.name: Park of the Year National Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Promotes the benefits and the role it plays within the green network
Demonstrates measures taken to enhance biodiversity, habitat co-location, liveability and its ability to reduce temperatures, connect and celebrate the community's culture and heritage
Articulates the role of the park within the community and the region
Demonstrates the role it plays to foster and build community engagement
Provides significant value to the community

3510016c-d68f-4875-bbb7-fecf41a0ae3f.description: This award is given to a playspace under the value of $500,000 that involves a range of stakeholders, contributes to the creation of a sense of 'place' for its local community and exhibits landscape and/or structural design innovation that delights and aids childhood development.
3510016c-d68f-4875-bbb7-fecf41a0ae3f.name: Playspace (<$0.5M) National Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Developed in accordance to the Local Government's Play Space Strategy and/or Open Space Strategy
Demonstrates the development of an asset management and replacement plan
Playspace features are intergenerational
The Playspace enhances the economic, environmental and social benefits to the region
Brings value to the community, demonstrates how it challenges learning, sensory and development outcomes

717a3020-e00e-412c-999b-37ece3887e40.description: This award acknowledges outstanding research achievement by a group or individual, professionals, student or academics who have made a significant contribution to the parks and leisure industry through expanded knowledge enhancement promoting the benefits or importance of the parks and leisure sector in Australian society.
717a3020-e00e-412c-999b-37ece3887e40.name: Research National Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: The research address a specific issue within the parks and leisure industry
The research has or can be applied to current parks and leisure operations throughout Australia

Authorship or co-authorship of peer-reviewed published materials such as journal articles, articles in conference proceedings, monographs, books, book chapters, artistic works, software development, or other professional and technical documents
The research demonstrates excellence in the consideration of economic, environmental, and social factors.

c7d2b513-2f98-4173-9b72-bd914084f0ba.description: This award recognises the development of strategies for parks, open space, sport, recreation and leisure opportunities by rewarding outstanding examples of strategic planning that have enriched and revitalised a community.
c7d2b513-2f98-4173-9b72-bd914084f0ba.name: Strategic and Master Planning National Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates alignment to strategic drivers and initiatives
Demonstrates integrated planning: national, state, region and/or local
Provides a high return on investment
Demonstrates the organisation has a good idea of how to allocate resources to align with goals
Demonstrates that one of the objectives is to enhance the community's ability to respond to chronic and accurate shocks
Demonstrates the community engagement process used to endorse the strategy or strategic plan

c2cafc81-fc9a-404c-a79c-5aca663a9a7a.description: This award recognises the development of strategies for parks, open space, sport, recreation and leisure opportunities by rewarding outstanding examples of strategic planning that have enriched and revitalised a community.

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates alignment to strategic drivers and initiatives
Demonstrates integrated planning: national, state, region and/or local

Demonstrates the organisation has a good idea of how to allocate resources to align with goals
Demonstrates that one of the objectives is to enhance the community's ability to respond to chronic and accurate shocks
Demonstrates the community engagement process used to endorse the strategy or strategic plan

46f02942-8d8a-4b7c-b51d-8b6b57dd3116.description: Regional/Rural Australia includes all of the towns, small cities and areas that lie beyond the major capital cities (Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide, Darwin, Hobart and Canberra) who make a significant contribution through community initiatives which contribute to the parks and leisure industry. These projects can be playspaces, events, tourism, trails, programs, repurposing of facilities and environmental initiatives (ie. water saving, habitat development and restoration projects).
46f02942-8d8a-4b7c-b51d-8b6b57dd3116.name: Best Regional / Rural Industry Contribution National Award 2022

Innovative approaches were taken

Contribution to lasting solutions and sustainability and the benefits to the community, the region and the industry

5debc46f-85a6-4626-bae3-9ed11474d807.description: PLA's longest standing award introduced by the Australian Leisure Institute. Named after a formal Federal Minister for Tourism and Recreation, this is the most prestigious individual award bestowed by PLA. The award recognises the significant contribution an individual has made to the development, promotion and advocacy of the parks and leisure industry through their personal and professional endeavours over a substantial period.
5debc46f-85a6-4626-bae3-9ed11474d807.name: Frank Stewart Distinguished Service National Award 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient has made significant contributions that have enhanced the development of colleagues within their workplace, Parks and Leisure Australia, and/or the broader parks and leisure industry, taking into consideration specific achievements and any barriers that were overcome.

Demonstrated high standard of professionalism and outstanding leadership within the parks and leisure industry (a minimum of 10 years), membership to the National Board, Regional Council, PLA Advisory or other parks and leisure committees.

The recipient has made personal and professional contributions that have enhanced the standard of the industry as a profession including regularly contributing to each State Regional Council’s events, committees and projects.

1296574b-dc16-42e7-914b-750f57d089c7.description: This award celebrates and promotes vibrant, successful well designed and managed new or significantly revitalised parks/ open spaces by recognising and rewarding exceptional examples of best practice in terms of design and management. This includes parks and open spaces that are large, small, linear, along transport corridors, road closures, foreshore and reclaimed urban spaces.

issuer.summary: issued by Parks and Leisure Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Promotes the benefits and the role it plays within the green network

Articulates the role of the park within the community and the region
Demonstrates the role it plays to foster and build community engagement
Provides significant value to the community

The research has or can be applied to current parks and leisure operations throughout Australia

The research demonstrates excellence in the consideration of economic, environmental, and social factors.
